Plughole
\ 
\ Select between the available data views using the buttons on the left.
\ 
\ GRAV shows the local gravitational field, showing the individual components on an X/Y plot and a vertical gauge for the Z axis. Additionally an altitude gauge shows the angle above or below the tricorder's horizontal plane. Below this the absolute magnitude of the gravitational field is graphed, and the raw numeric data is displayed.
\ 
\ MAG shows the local magnetic field, in the same format.
\ 
\ ENV shows some environmental sensor readouts: light level, object proximity, and temperature.
\ 
\ GEO shows geographic information. Availability of this information depends on the appropriate services being enabled.
\ 
\ EMS scans the electromagnetic spectrum for radio signals (as supported by hardware). Detected signals are shown as strength bars.
\ 
\ Note that the availability and accuracy of the information presented depends on the underlying hardware. In particular the magnetic field data is known to be unreliable on some currently available devices.
